lessons.title: Lesson 1: Introduction to Noora Health
lessons.description: Learn about the basic principles and science behind your condition. Get the 101 on how, what, and why about vascular surgery.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Introduction to Your Condition
lessons.description: Learn about the basic principles and science behind your condition. Get the 101 on how, what, and why about vascular surgery.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Caring for Your Cut
lessons.description: In this section we will layout the basics of what you can expect while going through the this training program for vascular surgery.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Warning Signs After Surgery
lessons.description: Learn the major things to watch out after your surgery. Recognize signs of complications in order to prevent emergencies.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Activity & Exercise
lessons.description: In this section we will layout the basics of getting back to exercise and physical therapy during recovery from vascular surgery.

lessons.title: Why is Exercise Important for Your Condition?
Lesson 2: Safety During Exercise
lessons.description: Learn the limitations, safety measures, and recognizing the warning signs of overexertion while active after surgery. Understand the limits of what is healthy and safe.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Nutrition to Heal After Surgery
lessons.short_title: Lesson 1: Nutrition to Heal After Surgery
lessons.description: Eating the right things after surgery can go a long way towards recovery. Learn which foods help, hurt, and why!

lessons.title: Why Nutrition is Important to Healing
Lesson 2: Practicing Nutrition Skills
lessons.description: Learn to apply the principles of a healthy diet to make smart choices at mealtime and snack-time.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Aspirin
lessons.description: In this section you will get to know this common better, including its uses, side effects, and benefits.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Plavix
lessons.description: Learn about taking Plavix, benefits and side effects.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Coumadin (Warfarin)
lessons.description: Learn about taking Coumadin, its benefits and side effects.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Improving Well-Being
lessons.description: In this section we will teach you about how to reduce your stress levels and improve your recovery with your mindset.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Smoking
lessons.description: Learn how smoking impacts the body after surgery and how to quit smoking.

lessons.title: Chapter 7: Family or Friend? Learn About Caregiving
Lesson 1: Caring for a Vascular Surgery Patient
lessons.short_title: Lesson 1: Caring for a Vascular Surgery Patient
lessons.description: In this section we will teach you about how to provide some basic support to a vascular patient that you would like to care for.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Caring for Yourself When You Care for Others
lessons.short_title: Lesson 2: Caring for Yourself When You Care for Others
lessons.description: Caregivers, whether family or friend, tend to forget to take care of themselves when they spend time caring for others. Learn some ways to combat this.

lessons.title: Chapter 8: Setting Goals for a Speedy Recovery
Lesson 1: Exercise & Activity Goals
lessons.description: In this section you will set goals for your physical activity after surgery.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Diet & Nutrition Goals
lessons.description: Set some goals for your diet after surgery that will help you recover and stay healthy.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Personal Well-Being Goals
lessons.description: Set some goals for your well-being after surgery that will help you recover and stay healthy.

modules.title: How to Care For Your Cut

modules.question: Question: I should take a shower as soon as I get home
Question: Taking a bath is better than showering since you can soak the cut in water
Question: My primary care doctor can remove my stitches or staples
Question: It is not that important to clean a cut around the groin area, since clothing protects it
Question: I can lift a gallon of milk a week after surgery
Question: Exposing my cut to sunlight makes it heal faster
Question: I can use lotions and powders to moisturize my cut
Scenario: A couple days after getting home I notice pale yellow fluid coming from my cut, and the edges are more red and swollen
Scenario: While walking my cut gets more painful and itchy
Scenario: As I am getting out of bed, my cut opens up and pulls apart
Scenario: I notice a rash developing near the cut, and the cut seems to be increasing in size and smell
Scenario: A week later, I see a bump near the cut that seems to be pulsating

modules.question: Scenario: I feel constipated and have not pooped for several days
Scenario: I feel some pain and itchiness around my cut, and when I move the pain gets worse
Scenario: A week after my surgery, I feel tired and have body aches and chills
Scenario: I suddenly feel very weak, confused, pale, and sweaty
Scenario: I do not have much of an appetite, and I have not eaten in a couple of days
Scenario: I feel pain in my lower leg when walking shorter and shorter distances
Scenario: A year after surgery, I feel a sudden and very severe pain in my back and stomach
Question: Will taking asprin help you poop?
Question: Will drinking plenty of fluids help you poop?
Question: Will eating a lot of buttery, fatty foods help you poop?
Question: Will exercise help you poop?
Question: Will eating foods high in fiber help you poop?
Question: Is straining on the toilet a good idea to help you poop?
Question: Will taking medications such as a stool softener help you poop?
Question: Will you be able to sit up?
modules.explanation: Only perform the following exercises if your doctor advises that they are right for you

modules.question: Question: Will you be able to stand up?
modules.explanation: Only perform the following exercises if your doctor advises that they are right for you

modules.question: Question: Will you be physically able to stand?
modules.explanation: Only perform the following exercises if your doctor advises that they are right for you

modules.title: Fall Prevention: Heel to Toe Walk

modules.question: Question: Right after surgery, can I take a shower to freshen up?
Question: A week after surgery, can I pick up and hold my 6-month-old granddaughter?
Question: I am taking a narcotic pain medication and I have pain when I sit. Can I drive?
Question: I feel pretty strong and do not get tired during the day. Can I got back to work?
Question: Two months after surgery, my cut has healed well and there is no break in the skin. Can I take a bath?
Question: A month after surgery, I can walk up a flight of stairs easily. Can I start having sex again?
Scenario: After a walk, my cut is sore, my heart rate is a bit faster than normal, and I am sweaty. What should I do?
Scenario: While riding a bike, I suddenly feel weak and numb. What should I do?
Scenario: I am playing tag, when I get light-headed and have a hard time catching my breath. What should I do?
Scenario: The light-headedness finally goes away in the evening. What should I do?
Scenario: I am gardening and get a pain in my chest that goes away after rest. What should I do?
Scenario: While dancing, I suddenly get a severe pain in my back that does not go away. What should I do?
